item.title: Why is Bitcoin surging since Britain voted to leave the EU?
item.description:
Why is Bitcoin surging since Britain voted to leave the EU?

Answer (1 of 3): Upon Brexit, there has been an expected flock to safety and safe haven assets. You see this across many traditional vents, including gold, yen, US dollar, etc today. What most people don't realize is that Bitcoin exhibits the same qualities as many of these other traditional safe...

item.title: Bitcoin price rise again thanks to the Brexit | HolyTransaction
item.description:
Bitcoin price rise again thanks to the Brexit | HolyTransaction

After reaching a low of $550 during the week, the bitcoin price rose again reaching a high of $650 today. Although it was normal to see a correction after the fast climb of the previous weeks, the bitcoin price probably fell also because of the " Bremain ", or the possibility of UK to remain into the EU.

item.title: 31 Chinese Firms Form Financial Blockchain Consortium - CoinDesk
item.description:
31 Chinese Firms Form Financial Blockchain Consortium - CoinDesk

Chinese financial services firm Ping An Bank and a subsidiary of QQ instant message app maker Tencent are among more than 30 technology and financial firms in China that have formed a new consortium dedicated to blockchain tech.

See the latest trends, data and visualizations from Google. Find out what's trending near you right now.

item.title: Updated: Segregated Witness Merged Into Bitcoin Core Release
item.description:
Updated: Segregated Witness Merged Into Bitcoin Core Release

Segregated Witness has been merged into Bitcoin Core. Original article: During a Bitcoin Core development meeting on Thursday, it was decided that the code for Segregated Witness (SegWit) is ready to be merged into the master branch. According to Bitcoin Core contributor Eric Lombrozo, the merge is expected to take place in the coming days.

item.title: Blockchain Startup Everledger Joins MasterCard Incubator - CoinDesk
item.description:
Blockchain Startup Everledger Joins MasterCard Incubator - CoinDesk

MasterCard has selected diamond provenance startup Everledger for its summer startup incubator. One of seven companies to join the 2016 Start Path Global program, Everledger and the other participants will receive assistance from MasterCard to scale their operations and enter new markets. The startups will begin the program by working with MasterCard during ...

item.title: As Global Currencies Plunge, Investors Are Turning to Bitcoin
item.description:
As Global Currencies Plunge, Investors Are Turning to Bitcoin

Global currencies might be plunging in the wake of the historic Brexit vote, but it's had a much different effect on Bitcoin. Bitcoin, the cryptocurrency that had been plunging in recent days, is soaring on Friday after the Brexit vote. As of this writing, Bitcoin is trading at $667.41 per unit, up significantly from a Thursday low of $582.92.

item.title: Following Brexit decision, bitcoin value surges ahead
item.description:
Following Brexit decision, bitcoin value surges ahead

The world economy floundered Friday following Great Britain's shocking decision to exit the European Union - but the bitcoin is proving that every action has an equal and opposite reaction.

item.title: Brexit Was Bitcoin's Turn to Shine
item.description:
Brexit Was Bitcoin's Turn to Shine

Gold is so last millennium. When traders were under the false impression that Britain's "remain" campaign had the upper hand, it was Bitcoin, not the barbarous relic, that really took it on the chin. The popular State Street SPDR exchange traded fund, which goes by the GLD ticker symbol, slumped on Thursday to its lowest in nearly three weeks.
